Works fine after you've patched it. Works on Vista to after that you've installed the v2.0 patch. Do not replace the original files, the patch setup does that automaticaly.After setup you can delete the patch folders. Always use original *.exe file to start the game! Thanks for the upload:)
Use daemontools for the image file!Its a virtual cd/dvd drive, so you dont have to burn the game onto cd. If you dont know how to do that dont bother downlading games from piratebay.

Use Daemontools for the image file. It is a virtual cd/dvd drive used to open cd image files so that you do not have to burn them.If you don't know how to do it, don't bother downloading games from piratebay.

Um, well i downloaded and installed, and then i tried to start it, it said it was not supported on windows NT. i have XP, Anyone know how to fix this?

I've got windows Vista. Open the zip folder and extract those to a directory. Using a mounting tool, mount 'Blood2.ccd'. Install as you would anything else.

Then head to someplace like fileplanet and download the Blood2 patch, released back in 1999, and install. Its about 12.2 MB in size. When that's installed you can run it in comparability mode. I selected XP for the sake of it.

**If I am wrong, or confused, I apologize. Call me on it and I'll look into how to help anyone.**
